intro: Mapania alpina, commonly known as the alpine mapania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas and is characterized by its compact growth habit and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
